instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
Hi there,

I'm very new to logic repair but have had some success and I've been watching the videos. I'm trying to troubleshoot the charger circuit on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I was able to very 3.42 to SMC and I have 3.42 at <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> pin 5 but no SMC BC ACOK there (.42mV). Also at <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR> I have 3.42 on pin 2 and .42mV on 1. Is the SMC toast? other things to verify?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is controlled by <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>), not by SMC.
There is very low chance that SMC (or <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>) input gets leakage and kills the signal; supposing <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR> is good, of course.

You didn't say anything avout <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (exact) voltage.
However we need few voltage readings on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins; 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = .201V at f7040
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> has a pit in the top of it I just discovered... :)
Here are the readings:
1-15.5v
2-16.1v
3-7.6v
9-2.24v
12-3.39v
13-3.35v
14-42mV
15-.3mV
17-.228V
19-5.5V
20-5.5V
27-7.1mV

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
"3-7.6v"
Are you sure about this?
There should be 4V aprox.
Check <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>/11; can be <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> fault also.

Also check and post exact resistance between pins 27/28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
Thanks for your help. I replaced the ISL being that it had a hole in the top. I didnt notice anything at all on the board at first but after you pointed me to that chip I saw something on top and scraped it and apparently it was a blister that lead to me discovering the pit in the chip. Not sure if I blew off <RESISTOR>R7002</RESISTOR> when I removed the ISL but I just noticed it is not there which is definitely a problem... 
I'll check the others you pointed me to.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
so after putting <RESISTOR>R7002</RESISTOR> on the board my readings on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> are the same except the following:
pin 9 has dropped to 9.2mV??
27 is at 4.5
14 & 15 still about .5mV

I checked <RESISTOR>R5441</RESISTOR> per the drop in voltage on pin 9 and it is reading 7.6k (schematic says 45.3k - so I assume this is bad but didnt know if there could be something on the circuit affecting the measurement besides the actual resistor).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
I said you to check the ACIN input resistors.
And some resistors on the pins 27/28...

Oh sorry wasn't sure if those were still needed w new isL and changes in voltages from that.

21.2 ohms btween pin 27/28

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message: You cannot have 7.6V at ACIN pin with these values; unless <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is bad...

Also check resistance between pins 17/18.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
Change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> again; pin 1 has incorrect voltage.
Post first diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light
threads.message:
Man, I dropped my hot air right on the board and did something that created a short. Ran current through it wo L6995and SMC was hot and blistered... Not sure I'm equipped to change that.

Thanks for your attempts to help me. I'm learning a lot!
